title: Can I Cancel or Edit a One-Time Zelle Payment? Here's When

steps.title: You can only cancel a Zelle payment if it's still pending.
steps.content: You can only cancel a Zelle payment if it's still pending. Generally, Zelle payments are instant, especially if the user already has an active Zelle account. However, if the recipient is not yet a Zelle user, the transaction may be marked as pending until they create an account. When a transaction is in the pending status, it can be cancelled. Keep in mind that pending transactions are rare. Most transactions are instant, so you most likely won't be able to cancel or reverse a Zelle payment. If you have a pending payment, you can easily cancel it . If you're a victim of fraud or a scam, you can try reporting it .

steps.title: Open the Zelle app.
steps.content: Open the Zelle app. Some banks or credit unions that support Zelle may allow access using their website. If this is available to you, you can log into your bank's website to use Zelle in a web browser.

steps.title: Select Transfer & Pay.
steps.content: Select Transfer & Pay . This option may vary depending on your bank. It can usually be found near your payment options.

steps.title: Select Send & request money with Zelle.
steps.content: Select Send & request money with Zelle . This option may vary depending on your bank. It can usually be found near your payment options.

steps.title: Select Activity.
steps.content: Select Activity . This will list all your recent activities on Zelle, including outgoing payments and received payments. You may be able to filter your transactions or use the search bar to find a specific one.

steps.title: Select the payment you want to cancel.
steps.content: Select the payment you want to cancel. This will be in the Pending payments section. If you don't see the transaction here, it has already been completed, and you won't be able to cancel it.

steps.title: Select Cancel payment.
steps.content: Select Cancel payment . This button will only be available on pending transactions.

steps.title: Select Cancel.
steps.content: Select Cancel . This will confirm the cancellation.

steps.title: If you were scammed through Zelle, you can contact Zelle to report your experience.
steps.content: If you were scammed through Zelle, you can contact Zelle to report your experience. Use the Report Scam page to send your contact information and information about the transaction to Zelle. Select the bubbles at the bottom that best represent your situation, and then fill out the form that appears. Zelle may be able to assist you, but it's unlikely that Zelle will be able to refund your money. You can also report scams and identity theft to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC). You may be covered under your bank's policies rather than Zelle's, though banks have not always had the best reputation for helping their customers recover from Zelle scams. steps.title: Can Zelle payments be reversed or cancelled?
steps.content: Can Zelle payments be reversed or cancelled? Zelle payments cannot be reversed or cancelled unless the transaction is still pending. A transaction may be marked as Pending only if the recipient does not have a Zelle account. If the recipient has an active Zelle account, the money is sent instantaneously, and you won't be able to cancel the transaction. [3] X Research source

steps.title: What can I do if I accidentally Zelle the wrong person?
steps.content: What can I do if I accidentally Zelle the wrong person? If you accidentally Zelle the wrong person, you cannot cancel the transaction. If you know the person, you can ask them to send you the money back. However, if the recipient is a stranger, it is usually unlikely that they will send the money back. For this reason, it's important to double-check the recipient information before sending money with Zelle, and only send money to those you trust. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Can you dispute a Zelle payment?
steps.content: Can you dispute a Zelle payment? There's no way to dispute a Zelle payment within the app. You can report a scam on the Zelle website, but your bank's customer support may be more helpful to you.

steps.title: Will Zelle refund money if scammed?
steps.content: Will Zelle refund money if scammed? You can report a scam or fraud on the Zelle website , but it's unlikely that Zelle will refund your money. Be sure to contact your bank immediately to understand your options with your specific bank. Some banks offer fraud protection and may be able to refund your transaction.
